articles.author: Lizzy Davies
articles.title: Ghana is first country to approve Oxford malaria vaccine - The Guardian
articles.description: Breakthrough hailed as highly effective R21 vaccine is cleared by west African country but questions remain over funding
articles.content:
Ghana has become the first country to approve a highly effective malaria vaccine developed at Oxford university in the UK.
The R21/Matrix-M vaccine, the first to exceed the World Health Organization… [+4799 chars]

articles.author: Dan Peppe, Kieran McNulty, Laura M. MacLatchy
articles.title: Wooded grasslands flourished in Africa 21 million years ago – new research forces a rethink of ape evolution - The Conversation
articles.description: Contrary to the idea that apes evolved their upright posture to reach for fruit in the forest canopy, the earliest known ape with this stature, Morotopithecus, lived in more open grassy environments.
articles.content:
Human evolution is tightly connected to the environment and landscape of Africa, where our ancestors first emerged.
According to the traditional scientific narrative, Africa was once a verdant idyll… [+9377 chars]
